lines.text: You love her? I own her!
Women, you can't live with them and you can't kill 'em.
[Frank is doing his routine for a group of cops]

My friend, Phil, he wants to join the police department. He goes to the station, and starts filling out the application. They ask him, "Mr. Scarangello, how tall are you?" And he looks at his right hand and says, "Uh, five foot ten." And they ask him, "how much do you weigh?" And he looks at his other hand, and says, "Two hundred and three pounds." So then they ask, "Okay, and what's your first name?" He goes...
[bobs his head from side to side, then]
"Philly." They ask him, "what are you doing with your head there?" He goes...
[bobbing]
"Happy Birthday to me, Happy birthday to me...?
[laughter]
You ought to try that tough guy shit with me sometime.
Fight me for her!
I just want to know if you're happy. Are you happy? 'Cause I get paid either way.
I'll be right back.
[goes to get some twinkies, for a colleague]
You're killin' him, Mad Dog... Get him some Melba toast.
Life is what happens to you while you're waiting for your ship to come in.
[Mad Dog is in a happy mood and singing]
What, you got laid last night?
I don't get laid, I make love.
[Glory catches Wayne counting money in the bathroom]
How much am I going for?
Is that all?
Knocked down from 75.
I must be out of season.
Do you know what botulism is? We can get her with soup.
Chivas and milk... I never forget a neck!
Slip your piece under the towel.
I got no beef with you.
Are you sweet? Is that your problem?
Come on, I'm on the job.
You ain't on my fuckin' job.

[Speaking to MadDog]
Hey ossifer, what's the word?

[after being accused, by Mike, of killing the shooter that was left in the garbage pail]
Oh and incidently, I don't know what you are talking about... a guy in a garbage pail... but uh, most of the people I know who don't die in bed... they usually wind up killing themselves.
[first lines]
Yo fellas, what's up?
Same old same old.
I got meatballs, I got ready rocks, I got gumballs. Shit, I even got gas starter kits.
Jumbos, two-twentys.
Two-twentys'll be 40.

[flashing bills]
You break this?
I ain't no cash machine.
It's the first time I pulled out my gin in 15 years. I pissed on myself.
You know why? Because you're a sensitive, intelligent indivdual.
You ever piss on yourself?

Look, I would'a walked in there and drilled the red-eyed little bastard, and that's just the way I am. On the other hand, if I ever had an intelligent thought, I would die a lonely guy. It all evens out, you know what I mean?
Look, if that ever happens again, the best thing is to have sex.
Are you married?
No. No, not personally, no.
Going to Frank is like taking heroin to cure an alcohol problem, ya know?

[mid make out]
I should do some sit-ups.
Right now?
I mean in general.
You always get someone to fight your fights for you?
Who am I to talk? You alright Harold?
[last lines]
Let's go home. Come on...
